humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that there are 2 out of 13 lymph nodes positive for malignancy in the axillary contents (D) and there are positive sentinel lymph nodes (B and C). This corresponds to N2 according to the AJCC staging system (New Rule 14 and New Rule 15).

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage for cancer is determined by the involvement of lymph nodes. According to the report, sentinel lymph node #1 and #2 are positive for metastatic carcinoma, and 2 out of 13 axillary lymph nodes are also positive for malignancy. This information corresponds to a pathologic N2 stage, which indicates that cancer has spread to 1-3 axillary lymph nodes or to the infraclavicular (claviicular) lymph nodes. The exact number of positive lymph nodes in this case is 3 out of 13, but for the purpose of N stage, N2 is the appropriate classification.
